body.p:
To
His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

Dear Sir -- We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County Ky. have long known Thomas. B. Wadlington & he has ever been considered a good & true hearted, loyal citizen. Known & noted, for his industry & his orderly & peaceable conduct. The difficulty in which he was engaged with M. A. Cartwright, did not appear to us, to be of his own seeking, nor are we satisfied, nor do we believe that the case was fairly presented to the jury, as it occurred -- We hope your Excellency will review the case, & give the poor man the benefit of every doubt & we desire, that his case may be judged with mercy & regarded with favor, & that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance, that ought to operate in his behalf. And we desire that your Excellency may be & will be persuaded; that it is consistent with your duty, to extend to him Executive Clemency, and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon or a commutation of his punishment -- Jany 22d 1861 --

Yours respectfully --
John, N, Dow. Sr
